page.text: To obtain a position in the Computer/Digital forensic that will utilize my educational skills and challenge me while giving unrelenting
support to Information Technology for the engineering development, manufacture and maintenance of a company's products and
interest.
Bloomsburg University of Pennsylvania
Bachelor of Science in Digital Forensics
Expected Graduation Date: December 2014
Digital Forensic Software - An extension of Digital Forensics File Systems I and II emphasizing basic and intermediate
forensic methodology, including reporting, used on a variety of file systems (FAT, NTFS, HFS, ext2 and ext3) using
windows tools and techniques.
Advanced Topic in Digital Forensics - A continuation of Forensic Analysis in a Windows Environment emphasizing
advanced forensic methodology, including reporting, on a variety of file systems (FAT, NTFS, HFS, ext2 and ext3) using
windows tools and techniques and court testimony.
Intro Computer Network - A hands-on introduction to concepts and issues of computer networks. Course introduces
theoretical issues of general computer networks along with installation and configuration of a simple local area network.
Computer and network hardware and software are surveyed.
Data Mining - Understand the concepts and issues involved in data mining and learn how to apply current software for
tree-structured data analysis to real-world problems.
Information Technology Intern, Saberpoint, Pompton Plains, NJ May 2013-June 2013
Disassembled parts of the computer
Reassembled parts of computer back together
Formatted hard disks
Assisted IT Manager with organizing computer parts and detecting if they were damaged
File Clerk, Mahwah Valley Orthopedic, Mahwah, NJ
June 2009- September 2009
Maintained the accuracy and alphabetical ordering of over 2,000 patient files in a busy medical practice
Retrieved and updated patience data as requested by office staff
Collaborated with doctors in assisting them with any paperwork that needed to be filled out
Rearranged files and organized them in an effective way for the office
Computer Forensics tools (HxD)
File Allocation Table
Parsing the Partition Table
Data Recovery
Excel, Word, Powerpoint
Software AccessData and EnCase
Member, Digital Forensic Club (Password Cracking)
Volunteer, Salvation Army Family Store
Volunteer, Fardale Trinity Church as a counselor
Member, Disciple Maker Fellowship
